column2: (to Bonnie) So ah, your first sexual experience was with a woman?!'
All right, I was 15, it was my best friend, Ruth, and we got drunk on\nthat hard cider, and then suddenly, I don\xc2\x92t know, we were, we were making out.'
Tell it again. (pause, we see Rachel is not amused.) Seriously.'
(to Monica) I mean is that woman capable of talking about anything else\nbut sex?'
Yeah, sure. Well y'know, earlier she was talking about geography."
Joey, she was listing the countries she\xc2\x92s done it in.'
Well, I think we all learned something.'
(entering, hurridly) Hey, you guys! Look what I found! Look at this!\n(She hands Chandler a picture) That\xc2\x92s my Mom\xc2\x92s writing! Look.'
(reading the back of the picture) Me and Frank and Phoebe, Graduation\n1965.'
Y'know what that means?"
That you\xc2\x92re actually 50?'

No-no, that\xc2\x92s not, that\xc2\x92s not me Phoebe, that\xc2\x92s\nher pal Phoebe. According to her high school yearbook, they were like B.F.F. (Ross and\nBonnie look at her quizzically) Best Friends Forever.'
Oh!'
That is so cool.'

I know! So this woman probably could like have all kinds of stories\nabout my parents, and she might even know like where my Dad is. So I looked her up, and\nshe lives out by the beach. So maybe this weekend we could go to the beach?'
Yeah! Yeah, we can!'
(to Ross) Shoot! I can\xc2\x92t go, I have to work!'
That\xc2\x92s too bad.'
(sarcastic) Ohh, big, fat bummerrr.'
So great! Okay! Tomorrow we\xc2\x92re gonna drive out to Montauk.'
Hey, Bonnie had sex there!'
(watching a happy couple walk by, arm in arm) Would you look at them. Am\nI ever gonna find a boyfriend again? I gonna die an old maid.'
You\xc2\x92re not gonna die an old maid, maybe an old spinster cook.'
(sarcastic) Thanks!'
Hey now besides, if worst comes to worst, I\xc2\x92ll be your boyfriend.'
Yeah right.'
Why is that so funny?'
You made a joke right? So I laughed.'
Ha-ha-ha. A little to hard. What am I not ah, boyfriend material?'
Well, no. You\xc2\x92re Chandler. Y'know, Chandler! (hits him on the arm)"

Okay, so we\xc2\x92ve established my name, and hit me. But theoretically\ny'know, I mean say we weren\xc2\x92t friends, say it\xc2\x92s a blind date. I show up at your\ndoor, and I\xc2\x92m like (in a fake voice) \xc2\x93Hey, nice to meet, ya. Hey, oh-hey.\xc2\x94"
Well I\xc2\x92d probably be scared of a guy using a fake voice.'
(walking up carrying a brown paper bag) Hey!'
Oh, hey! Oh good, you brought food!'
No, it\xc2\x92s just my luggage.'
Hey!!'
Woo-hoo! All right! Yeah!'
Oh, I am having the best karma this week. First, I find this woman who\nknew my parents, and then my client with the fuzzy back gives me his beach house.'
Yeah? What about ah, that bike messenger you hit?'
Oh, I wasn\xc2\x92t talking about his karma.'
(approaching) Hey! '
Hey!'
Hey-hey, check out the hat!'
What a minute, I know that hat! I was taken aboard that hat! They did\nexperiments on me! I can\xc2\x92t have children!!'
Seriously, where did you get the hat?'
Ross gave it to me.'
Yeah, I think she looks good.'
Ohh, thank you.'
Buy it for ya, or win it for ya?'
Well excuse me, my fashion-impaired friends, I am here to tell you that\nhats are back.'
And this time, they\xc2\x92ve ganged up to form one giant, super hat.'
Go, go, go!'
Oh yeah, now everybody wants to be under this hat!'
Oy!!'
What\xc2\x92s with all this sand? (picking a handful of sand off of the\nfloor, which is covered in sand)'
Oh, yeah, Bob said there might be flood damage.'
Yeah, either that, or he has a really big cat.'
Well, yes, it\xc2\x92s kind\xc2\x92ve an unusual house. It has umm, three\nbeautiful bedrooms and ah, no baths. But y'know, the ocean is right there."
(at the door) Knock, knock, knock.'
(on phone) Ah, oh, hang on a second. (to Phoebe) Come in, come in.\n(on phone) All right, so think about it, and call me back. (hangs up)'
(entering) Are you ah, Phoebe Abott?'
Ahh, yes.'
Hi Phoebe Abott, I\xc2\x92m your best friends daughter!'
You\xc2\x92re Erwin\xc2\x92s daughter?!'
No, I-I mean your-your old best friend, here. (hands her the picture)\nLily, from high school. Remember?'
Oh gosh, Lily, yes. Of course I remember Lily. I... Then you must be?'
(points to herself) Phoebe. (points to her) Phoebe. Phoebe, yeah. She\nnamed me after you I guess.'
Uh-huh. Wow! Well, look! There\xc2\x92s Frank. (points to the picture.)'
Yes!! Yes! Yes! Yes!! That\xc2\x92s my Dad, that\xc2\x92s Frank! Yeah!\nI\xc2\x92m sorry I\xc2\x92m getting all flingy.'
Take it easy--if you want, there\xc2\x92s cookies on the counter, or,\nor--sangria! (jumps up) I can make sangria!'
No-no, sorry. Cookies are good, thanks. '
Oh.'
(goes and gets some cookies) Well, so, umm, anyway umm, I\xc2\x92ve been,\nI\xc2\x92ve been looking for my Father, and umm, have you heard from him, or seen him?'
Oh no, I-I\xc2\x92m sorry, I guess we lost track of everybody after\nhigh school.'
(disappointed) Oh, okay. Well, so tell me everything about my parents.\nEverything.'
Ohh, well. Y'know we were always together, in fact the had a nickname\nfor the three of us."
Oh, what? What was it?'

The three losers. Oh, poor Lily. (Phoebe notices a picture on the\nfridge, takes it, and puts it in her pocket.) Ohh, y'know I-I heard about what happened,\nthat must have been just terrible for you, losing your mother that way."
(happily) Yeah, no, it was great.'
(getting an idea) Hey, y'know what a really good rainy day game is?"
What?!'
I mean naked game. Strip poker, we should totally play strip poker.'
No, no!'
What are you crazy?!'
Come on! When you go away, you-you have to play, it\xc2\x92s like a law!'
(to Monica) Allll done!'
Aww, thank you.'
Okay, who\xc2\x92s next?! (She looks around the room, and stops when she\ncomes to Ross.)'
No-o-o! (Rachel gives him a \xc2\x93Please?\xc2\x94 look.) No way! '
Come on, please?! I\xc2\x92m boredddd! You let me do it once before.'
Yeah well, if ah, if that\xc2\x92s the rule this weekend... (She gets up)\nNo!'
Yes! (she starts creeping up on him)'
Get away!'
Just once! '
Stay away!'
Take it like a man, Ross!'
(he gets up and starts to run away from her) No! (in his escape attempt he\ncrushes Chandler\xc2\x92s sand castle) No!'
Oh, come on!'
Big bullies!!'
Ow! Ow! Oh, no-no-no!'
(entering) Oh, hey!'
Hey!'
Hey!'
Oh, so, how are we doing?'
Bored and bored!'
Hey, you know what naked card game is never boring?'
Noo!!'
(to Phoebe) So what\xc2\x92s Phoebe like?'
I\xc2\x92m kind, caring, and sweet. What\xc2\x92s Monica like?'
Ah no, the other Phoebe, the one you went to go see.'
Ohh, I think she knows where my Dad is.'
What?'
Really?!'
Oh well, where is he?!'
She was acting, she was pretending like she hasn\xc2\x92t heard from him\non years, but I found this picture on her fridge, and look (shows Monica)! Isn\xc2\x92t this\nwhat he would look like now?'
(gasps) Totally familiar. (Phoebe shows the rest of them.)'
Oh, yeah.'
Yeah!'
Well, why would she lie to you?'

I don\xc2\x92t know, but we\xc2\x92re having dinner tomorrow night, so I\nfigured, she\xc2\x92s gonna tell me then. Y'know maybe she just wanted to give him time to,\nbuy me presents, I don\xc2\x92t know! So, you\xc2\x92re all bored?"
Ohh!!'
Yes!'
All right, I\xc2\x92m gonna close my eyes and point to someone, and you,\nwhoever I point has to come up with something fun for us to do, and we have to do\nit. '
Okay, all right. '
Okay.'
Fan out! Fan out!'
Okay. (Starts to spin) Ooh, y'know we could just do this. (She stops at\nChandler)"
Okay, umm, we all have to play strip poker.'
(jumping in triumph) OH YES!!!!!'
Strip Happy Days Game?'
Yeah, well, I couldn\xc2\x92t find any cards, so it was either this or Strip\nBag Of Old Knitting Stuff.'
Okay, (reading the card) Fonzy gives you two thumbs up, collect two cool\npoints. Yeah.'
Monica, if you get five cool points, you get to make somebody take off\none item of clothing. It hasn\xc2\x92t happened yet, but we\xc2\x92re all very excited.'

Okay, come on! (blows on the dice) Daddy needs a new pair of
electromagnetic microscopes for the Prehistoric Forensics Department! (They all look at
him, and he shuts up and rolls the dice.) (he moves his piece) Okay. (reading a card) Take
Pinky Tuscadero up to Inspiration Point, collect three cool points!! Yeah! Which gives me
five, and let\xc2\x92s see who is gonna lose their clothes. Ummmm, I think I pick our strip
poker sponsor Mr. Joey Tribianni.'
All right, relax. It\xc2\x92s just a shoe.'
Wooooo!!!!'
(reading a card) Okay, your band is playing at Arnold\xc2\x92s, collect\nthree cool points. Which means, I have five, and that means I get Joey\xc2\x92s boxers!'
Fine. Gang up on me! I got you all right where I want you.'
Come on, take \xc2\x91em off!!'
Actually, y'know it\xc2\x92s kinda cold, so how about I keep my boxers on,\nand give you all a peek at the good stuff?"
(getting up) All right, I\xc2\x92m gonna make more margaritas! (She pours\nthe rest of the pitcher into Ross\xc2\x92s glass.)'
Whoa, hey! What are doing? Trying to get me drunk?'
I\xc2\x92m just making margaritas.'
Okay.'
I think I\xc2\x92ll help her out. (She gets up to go over and help Rachel,\nand reveals she has no pants.) (to Rachel) What is going on here?'
What?! '
You painting his toenails?'
Oh, come on!'
Chasing him all around the room?'
Monica, please?'
He\xc2\x92s totally flirting with you too.'

(pause) He is, isn\xc2\x92t he? I don\xc2\x92t know, I don\xc2\x92t know, I\nmean maybe it\xc2\x92s just being here at the beach together or, I don\xc2\x92t know. But\nit\xc2\x92s like something... (she\xc2\x92s interrupted by the sound of Bonnie entering)'
Hey!'
Hey! (Rachel is shocked) Hi Bonnie!'
Hi! My boss let me off early, so I took the train. '
Oh.'
What are you guys doing?!'
We\xc2\x92re playing Strip Happy Days Game!'
Cool! I\xc2\x92ll catch up! (She takes off her sweater.)'
So, you still don\xc2\x92t think I\xc2\x92m boyfriend material?'
Huh?'
I saw you checking me out during the game last night.'
You didn\xc2\x92t even take off your pants.'
Yeah, well, lucky for you.'
What?'
I don\xc2\x92t know.'
(entering) Well! Is everybody else having just the best time?!'
Shhh! Shhhh! Joey\xc2\x92s asleep.'
After he passed out, we put the sand around him to keep him warm.'
Well I assume the ah, happy couple isn\xc2\x92t up yet. Did you guys hear\nthem last night?'
Oh, yeah, I don\xc2\x92t know what they were doing, but at one point sea\nturtles actually came up to the house.'
Good morning.'
Hey.'
Hey! How did everybody sleep?'
Oh, great.'
Like a log.'
Us too.'
I\xc2\x92m going for a walk.'
(to Joey) Good morning. Nice breasts by the way.'
Hey, what happened to you?'
Oh, ah nothin\xc2\x92. I just felt like hangin\xc2\x92 out here and reading.'
Oh, the water was sooo great! We jumped off this pier and my suit came\noff.'
Ohhhh, sorry I missed that.'
Yeah, Joey and Chandler sure are funny. '
Ohh-ha-ha!'
I think I brought back half of the beach in my hair. It was so much\neasier when I used to shave my head.'
Y'know, I gotta tell ya, I just loved your look when you were\nbald."
Really?!'
Ohh!'
Because I think about shaving it all off again sometime.'
Really?!'
Yeah!'
I mean you definitely should do that.'
Y'know what, I should do it."
Yeah!'
Yeah, thank you Rachel, you are soo cool.'
Awww, stop. Come on. Now go shave that head!'
All right.'
What\xc2\x92s the matter, Pheebs?'
She cancelled! My namesake cancelled on me!'
What?!'
Yeah, she clamed she had to go out of town suddenly. She\xc2\x92s avoiding\nme, she doesn\xc2\x92t want to tell me where my Father is. She knows, and she won\xc2\x92t\ntell me.'
Aww Pheebs, that sucks!'
Yeah, well, don\xc2\x92t \xc2\x93Aww Pheebs, that sucks!\xc2\x94 me yet. (she\nstarts to leave)'
Where ya going?'
Well, she\xc2\x92s out of town so, there\xc2\x92s gotta be something in her\nhouse that tells me where my Father is.'
Uh, Pheebs, some people call that breaking and entering.'
Well, are any of those people here?!'
Oh, no!! No, no!'
Okay, look I-I-I do something nice, okay? I\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll fill her\nice trays.'
Hey, everybody!'
Wow!! (they all recoil in shock and horror)'
Wh-haa-haa! Look what \xc2\x91cha did! (Rachel has her hand over her mouth\nto keep from laughing.)'
You wanna touch it?'
Nooo, but it, but it\xc2\x92s great.'
Come on, touch it!'
Okay. (He gently touches it.) You can feel all the bones in your skull.'
Hi.'
Hi!'

I was having a little chat with ah, Bonnie, and ah, guess what, she-she\nhappened to bring up y'know, who was behind the um, whole head shaving idea, and now, who\nwas it? Oh, that\xc2\x92s right, that\xc2\x92s right, it was you!"
That was her idea, I just gave her a nudge.'
She said you gave her the razor!'
(joining them) Hey guys.'
Hey!'
So, anyone up for a midnight dip in the ocean?'
Ahh, no, I\xc2\x92m good.'
Okay, I\xc2\x92ll see you in a bit.'
Okay, have fun! Wooo!!'
Come on see, she doesn\xc2\x92t look that bad.'
You can see the moonlight bouncing off her head! What the hell were you\nthinking?!!'
I don\xc2\x92t know.'
You don\xc2\x92t know?! Rach, you balded my girlfriend!'
All right! Ross, do you think it\xc2\x92s easy for me to see you with\nsomebody else?'
Y'know, hey! You\xc2\x92re the one who ended it, remember?"
Yeah, because I was mad at you, not because I stopped loving you!'
You still love me?'
Noo.'
You still love me.'
Oh, y-yeah, so, you-you love me!'
Noo, nnnnn. What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you wanna, get\nback together?'
Noo! Maybe! I, I don\xc2\x92t know. Ross, I still can\xc2\x92t forgive you\nfor what you did, I can\xc2\x92t, I just, but sometimes when I\xc2\x92m with you I just, I\nfeel so...'
What?!'
I just, I feel, I-I just...'
What?'
I feel...'
(to Joey) Noo!! I don\xc2\x92t care! I\xc2\x92m not, I\xc2\x92m not gonna\nplaying one-on-one strip poker with you for practice! '
But I made cards!!'
Well! Good night. (to Ross) I\xc2\x92m going upstairs.'
G\xc2\x92night.'
(to Ross) Wanna play strip poker for practice?'
Ow! My ass. Okay. Okay. (She manages to climb completely inside and the\nwindow slams shut.) Oh, shhh!'
No! No!! It\xc2\x92s me! It\xc2\x92s me! I-I didn\xc2\x92t want to make any\nnoise!'
Then don't break in!!"
I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
What are you doing here?!'
I-I, came to fill your ice cube trays.'
What?!'

Umm, okay, okay, look. I took this picture from your fridge. Okay,
because I know that this is my Father. Yeah, this is Frank Buffay and you are standing
right there next to him. Now, look I deserve to know where I came from. All right? So if
you can help me find my Father then you should! Otherwise, you\xc2\x92re just mean! (pause)
So, just tell me the truth!'
All right, the man in the picture is Chuck Magioni. '
My Father is Chuck Magioni?'
No, no, that\xc2\x92s just Chuck Magioni, I-I sold him a house last\nyear! And I\xc2\x92m very sorry, but I don\xc2\x92t know where your Father is, and that\xc2\x92s\nthe truth.'
Oh.'
But umm, you\xc2\x92re right. I think that a person should know where\nthey come from. Wh-which is why I ah, (pause) ahh, (pause) okay. I\xc2\x92m your mother.'
Heh?'
Y'know I wanted to tell you yesterday, but I just, I kinda felt all\nfloopy, and... "
I\xc2\x92m telling ya, you guys are totally getting back together!'
That\xc2\x92s not true! Her, she doesn\xc2\x92t even know what she wants!\nRachel\xc2\x92s still mad about the whole thing.'
Okay, then you gotta back away, all right? You don\xc2\x92t need that\nkind\xc2\x92ve hurt. Take it from a guy who\xc2\x92s never had a long term relationship......'
I know, but ahhhhhh!! I really wanna go up there and finish that kiss!'
(coming back from her swim) Hey!'
Ahhhh! (Steps away from her.)'
You guys, the water\xc2\x92s great. You should really go in.'
Oh, ahh, no thanks, I just had an M&M.'
Okay, well g\xc2\x92night.'
Good night.'
(kisses Ross) Don\xc2\x92t be too long.'
Okey-dokey!'
There is not one hair on that head.'

Hey, it\xc2\x92ll grow back, right? And she-she\xc2\x92s really fun, and
she\xc2\x92s cool, and-and I\xc2\x92m finally moving on. Y'know? I mean getting over Rachel
was so (makes an incoherent nasal sound), y'know? Y'know, and I\xc2\x92m finally feeling
sane again. And now if I go up there, and-and I kiss her, and, Gooood I wanna kiss her,
and-and-and it doesn\xc2\x92t work out, right? Do I really wanna put myself through that
again?"
So let me get this straight. If you go with Bonnie tonight, you\xc2\x92re\ndoing the smart, healthy thing and moving on.'
Yeah.'
Right, and you go with Rachel, Bonnie\xc2\x92s free tonight?'
(entering the bedroom) Hi. (closes the door)'
(in a fake voice) Hi there.'
That\xc2\x92s that weird voice again.'
Okay! Okay! Let me try it again, you\xc2\x92re gonna wanna date this\nnext guy, I swear!'
Hi! I\xc2\x92m Dorf! You\xc2\x92re date for the evening. (Monica walks\naway in disgust) Oh come on! Dorf on dating, that\xc2\x92s good stuff!!'
